summary: If Peter Parker were to go on an Avengers mission, you bet your ass that he wouldn't fail. He wouldn't slip up, because he was...
body: If Peter Parker were to go on an Avengers mission, you bet your ass that he wouldn’t fail. He wouldn’t slip up, because he was so anxious he already pictured how this would end in every way possible. Hell, he planned for when a stray elephant charged into the room. Like on the outside hes all confident like ‘oh yeah totally. I got this dont worry birdbrains’ but in the inside hes like 'okay so if i go by this specific angle off of that stray piece of metal i’ll be able to save mr. stark from being crushed by the vulture whos in prison far away at this moment’

summary: okay so I have a friend, and we’ve been discussing a lot of marvel theories, but in honor of the late and great Stan Lee, here’s...
body:
okay so I have a friend, and we’ve been discussing a lot of marvel theories, but in honor of the late and great Stan Lee, here’s an idea for the marvel funeral he deserved:

literally EVERYONE who’s played a Marvel superhero shows up in costume, and I mean full costume. Like rdj walks in wearing a full metal suit, possibly arrives by helicopter, jeremy renner is wearing a quiver with real arrows. When mark ruffalo gets up to give a speech, he gets all mad and emotional, then scarlett johansson has to do the sun is setting thing. chris pratt saunters in listening to his walkman, looks up and realizes its a funeral, kinda goes “oh shit” and tries to leave but zoe saldana grabs his arm and goes “you’re staying” and shoves him into a seat. tom holland swings in on a rope dressed as spider-man, then ducks into a closet and comes out a minute later in a suit, then at some point does a backflip, looks around, and nods like nobody saw it. plums are served and sebastian stan literally looses his shit, and then every actor whose character is a serviceman (cap, bucky, rhodey, sam) are the casket bearers and they’re in full military dress and they lower the casket and present the flag to Stan Lee’s family. Heroes die but one death, but legends never die. Stan Lee deserves this level of immortalization in comic-themed funeral form

title: Monster
body:
“Have you ever asked yourself, do monsters make war, or does war make monsters?”

Five

I was right for thinking I’d hate the malt machine. I was forced to follow another waiter around on my first day and make mental notes about what I was doing. Now I was required to hand out plates…

Read more…
